Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2016 09:40AM Grandi wrote: Dtad, it is my understanding that once a cancer is going to spread, it does not go through all the stages. Once it spreads it is Stage 4 unless it is a local recurrence in the breast. So stage 1 does not go to stage 2, 3, and then 4. It does go from stage 1 rightto stage 4 if it spreads. Also, tumor marker blood tests are not standard of care. They are unreliable and anxiety producing. Some people did not have elevated tumor markers at time of diagnosis. A simple head cold can raise tumor markers as can dental work or anything that causes inflammation in the body. Most of the newly trained oncologists are not doing tumor markers. .
